Test Description: Assess one-hop optimization -- selecting the best tile to add to the current game state
Difficulty Notes: Focusing on very easy scenarios for now, where there is just one or two hops of reasoning.
Question: Which is the second-best domino the player could add to their kingdom to maximize its score? Output the following: Domino letter, Previous kingdom score, new kingdom score.
Answer: Domino: C, Previous kingdom score: 3, New kingdom score: 7
Rationale: Domino D scores three points simply from having a three-crown mine. Additionally, it can be placed under the one-crown wheat/forest tile, which connects it to the other two wheat fields. Domino C could net 4 new points if placed to connect the same wheat fields with domino D. However, the one-crown lake square on C only nets 1 point, instead of the 3 from the black mine in D.
